subject: thank you notes 4/12
body:
i'm thankful that one of my favorite writers, [ruth curry](http://twitter.com/ruthcurry), started a tinyletter yesterday called [coffee & tv](http://tinyletter.com/coffeeandtv). i'm thankful for the first issue of the newsletter, which has profound and funny things to say about coffee (_"Drinking it, and not enjoying it as much as I expected to, reminded me it is actually possible to change things about your life, even things (in this case, cream and two sugars) you consider fixed or intrinsic to 'you."_), tv ("_One of the main arcs of the show is the transformation – slow, difficult, fraught with setbacks -- of their marriage from a purely business arrangement to a “real” relationship. As a viewer, you are really, really rooting  for their relationship to work out, to stay “real,” or at least I am_"), los angeles ("_When I described the hotel to a coworker as 'fancy but kind of crappy at the same time_,' she said, '_Sounds like LA.'_"), and more ("_cropped sweatpants, oversized tank top, extremely oversized blanket/poncho/shawl garment, bright-purple-and-turquoise New Balance 501_s"). i'm thankful to recommend that [you subscribe here](http://tinyletter.com/coffeeandtv). 

i'm thankful for _fear the walking dead_, which in its deep pocketed mediocrity has the power to make _the walking dead,_ which i frequently think is pretty dumb even while still enjoying watching it, seem like a profound work of art. i'm thankful, when watching badly-written TV, to play a game with D where we try to guess what cliche line the characters will say next, which definitely adds to the entertainment value. i'm thankful for this pair of recent articles about new frontiers of televisual fuckery: a profile of [the staff that makes the blurs](http://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/11/business/media/on-the-job-blurring-the-private-parts-in-naked-and-afraid.html?_r=0) on _naked & afraid_ and an article about "[how actors get plastic surgery with a mouse click](http://www.vulture.com/2016/03/special-effects-c-v-r.html)" ("_Ironically, digital-effects companies like Lola are now busy undoing actual plastic surgery on actors whose 'faces are pulled too tight,' Lola’s Williams has said. 'They’ll come in with too much Botox. There’s no movement in their brows. There’s been a few projects where we’ve had to animate the brow to give the performance it should be giving_.'") 

i'm thankful for last week's [_entertainment weekly_ spread](http://www.ew.com/article/2016/04/07/gilmore-girls-revival-ew-cover) about the netflix _gilmore girls_ sequels and to be reminded of david cho's [_gilmore girls_ advocacy](http://www.theawl.com/2011/05/my-latest-obsession-why-you-should-give-gilmore-girls-another-chance). i'm thankful that [melissa mccarthy is going to be in the _gilmore girls_ sequels](http://www.chicagotribune.com/entertainment/tv/ct-5-reasons-gilmore-girls-needs-melissa-mccarthy-20160411-story.html), even though her character always felt tonally like she was in a slightly different show. i'm thankful that i remembered when i once made [an organ drone cover of the _gilmore girls_ theme](https://songsaboutbuildingsandfood.wordpress.com/?s=where+you+lead) (the post also includes a bonus DVD featurette about the end of the "relationship" described in yesterday's notes!). i'm thankful for kool a.d.'s verse on "[nutmeg](https://www.google.com/url?sa=t&rct=j&q=&esrc=s&source=web&cd=1&cad=rja&uact=8&ved=0ahUKEwih9JKklonMAhXJrYMKHRXqA0kQyCkIHjAA&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3DIg9Audtm9VI&usg=AFQjCNGbQUpRgPZ_h2Ed8Xhp49l5lV-6hg&sig2=uDLetXVPKnUu103tSfNVtg&bvm=bv.119028448,d.amc)," which begins:

"_Hey yo, that’s amazing, blunt in your mouth talk_

_Silly strutters, [Sally Struthers, Gilmore Girls](http://www.eonline.com/news/741009/gilmore-girls-revival-sally-struthers-is-in-plus-find-out-which-other-fan-favorite-is-also-returning)_

_Smothers Brothers at The Fillmore_

_Hand me that capo_

_Cop all of my Snapple at Staples_

_Four flavor kettle corn_

_Heavy metal porno flick chicks with tattoos_

_Rolling up spliffs with Bambus_"

i'm thankful that the other morning, i was inspired, perhaps by my memory of its use on the classic _gilmore girls_ episode "[concert interruptus](http://gilmoregirls.wikia.com/wiki/Concert_Interruptus)," to listen to "[eternal flame](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PSoOFn3wQV4)" by the bangles. i'm thankful, not having heard that song for a long time, for how surprised i was at the production, that i had remembered it as this intimate acoustic thing but that there are string sections and massed choirs and weird synths and a kitchen sink more of production (i'm thankful that the song is still affecting despite/because of all this and thankful especially for the sweetly reassuring choral ending). i'm thankful for the way susanna hoffs sings the line "_do you feel the same,_" which always sounds like "_do you feel_ a _same_?" to me because of the weirdness of her enunciation or something. 

i'm thankful that recently i had a similar issue with "[summer sixteen](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bY4OJBGBOY4)," where i thought that drake was saying "_tell obama that my verses are just like the whips at the end, they bulletproof_," which, besides seeming factually wrong (why would they just be bulletproof at the end??), combined with his line about "_why would I put on a vest? i expect you to aim for the head_" to make me worry for drake's security team (i'm thankful i realized that line is actually "_the_ _whips that he in_"). i'm thankful for [mondegreens](http://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/15/magazine/lady-mondegreen-and-the-miracle-of-misheard-song-lyrics.html) and for all my starbucks lovers. i'm thankful for this bit of fucked up trivia from the wiki for "eternal flame": "_In the BBC programme_ I'm In a Girl Group_, Hoffs revealed she actually sang the studio recording of the song completely naked due to the producer Davitt Sigerson pranking her by telling her Olivia Newton John had done the same thing but he later told Hoffs he had been lying the whole time._" i'm thankful for this anecdote from the cowriter about the origin of the song and for its conflation of elvis and jesus: 

"_Susanna was talking about the Bangles having visited Graceland, and she said there was some type of shrine to Elvis that included some kind of eternal flame. As soon as those words were mentioned, I immediately thought of the synagogue in the town of Palm Springs, California where I grew up. I remember during our Sunday school class they would walk us through the sanctuary. There was one little red light and they told us it was called the eternal flame_."

i'm thankful for the long conversation i had about dreams with a staff member in another office yesterday. i'm thankful she started the conversation by asking me if i ever have dreams of flying and i told her that frustratingly i don't, that instead what i have are dreams where i leap up off the ground, my body describing an arc high into the air, and then i hit the apex of the curve and begin to fall, which is briefly terrifying, but then when i hit the ground, my legs are springs that send me back up into the sky. i'm thankful she told me that when she was in high school, she always had flying dreams in which she was sitting on a piece of cardboard and flying above her mother, who was trying to grab the cardboard and pull her down to the ground--i'm thankful for our ironic laughter about that dream couldn't have any real meaning. i'm thankful that in conversation with her, i realized that i don't ever have running dreams, even though i run every day, but that i often have driving dreams, even though i haven't driven a car since i was 15. i'm thankful that i came to her desk to get a key but that she just kept talking about dreams to me for the longest instead of giving me the key, which felt like something that would happen in a dream.
